Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the Supreme Court warned only Vice President Leni Robredo to stop discussing the poll case, when in fact the warning was directed at both the Robredo and Marcos camps.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or source to back up the statement that the Supreme Court warned only Vice President Leni Robredo.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Vice President Leni Robredo was the only one warned by the Supreme Court, without considering the possibility that both parties were warned.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Supreme Court warning was directed at both the Robredo and Marcos camps, not just Robredo alone.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the warning issued by the Supreme Court and presenting an incomplete and misleading picture of the situation.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation to the claim is that the warning from the Supreme Court was not specifically targeting Vice President Leni Robredo, but rather both parties involved in the poll case.
